most DLLs are loaded by Chrome. Preload dxcompiler.dll so that the

entry.title: [DragDrop] Enables drag and drop to omnibox for links.
entry.content:
Creates the base classes required to set up drag and drop to the

omnibox. Attaches a onDragListener to the ToolbarContainer which then

launches the TargetView given the valid conditions. The TargetView

responds to the drag events, and initiates a navigation when a link is

dropped on it.



Here is a demo of the Target View:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/17BiVRQPzaJClAJobJfGo56Q8OZfgSQFc/view?usp=sharing

entry.title: cros_next: add blurred background to pill button
entry.content:
Sometimes the pill buttons need the background blur effect to make

the label more clear. Directly setting background blur to pill

button's layer will make all the rectangle area blur. Setting

rounded corner radius to the layer will clip the contents of the

button and its children. For example, the focus ring will be

clipped. Therefore, we should set a separate background shield to

the button for the background blur effect.



Background blur is performance consuming so we should make it

optional and only enable it as needed.



This CL adds a BlurredBackgroundShield variable to the PillButton.

When background blur is enabled, the blurred background shield will

replace the button's background.



The final effects are shown in the bug comments.



Bug: b:277915834

Change-Id: I51bf1c53f0128eea5d1e0b5509076c1ec9a5e08f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4643088

entry.title: [Sampling Profiler] Enable profiler for 90% of Android population
entry.content:
As of Jul 18th, 2023, the SyntheticStackProfilingConfiguration finch

trial (https://uma.googleplex.com/p/chrome/variations?sid=2ff889a349a16d6456b729e2b0674d42)

is no longer showing DAU/count regression in both dev/canary channel.



The DAU/count regression was fixed by https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4594839



This CL enables profiling for 90% of Android population. As discussed in the bug, the change overall will spread out the profiling workload more evenly among the user population so each user is affected less performance wise.

entry.title: gardening: Revert "[webauthn] Always filter passkeys by allow-list"
entry.content:
This reverts commit a0e7eaa16dd8d6b9943e19c2098f2f77d376c6d2.



Reason for revert: browser test is flaky on Mac



Original change's description:

> [webauthn] Always filter passkeys by allow-list

>

> When servicing a webauthn request, chrome requests discoverable

> credential metadata matching the request from local authenticators.

> These are filtered to match the request's allow list. However, GPM

> passkeys are obtained directly from sync, so they are not being

> filtered, which causes chrome to display passkeys that are not eligible

> for the request.

>

> ChromeAuthenticatorRequestDelegate's credential_filter_ already filters

> all credentials after they are discovered, but only for conditional

> requests. This CL expands that behaviour to cover modal requests as

> well, which fixes the bug.

>

> Bug: 1459273

> Change-Id: I254a242b7c30ee8387c25c03a1bd8d0ca227d6d5

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4697896

> Commit-Queue: Nina Satragno

> Reviewed-by: Ken Buchanan

> Auto-Submit: Nina Satragno

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1172547}



Bug: 1459273, 1466329

Change-Id: I79621100dfb885f9c2d6b82d750eb35f8a9bec5a

entry.title: Enable the consistently passing tests in SharedWorkerServiceImplTest
entry.content:
This change is part of the effort to re-enable consistently passing

tests across the entire chromium.

If the tests are reasonable, please LGTM and I will proceed to submit

the change.

If the tests are unreasonable, please let me know and I will remove

them.





------ How the change is created ------



I do not inspect each individual test case, the idea is to run the

disabled tests on reviver builders

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/g/reviver/builders and use the

aggregated results to decide if a previously disabled test is now

consistently passing.



Usually I create changes by directly enabling the tests. If the tests

are failing on platforms not covered by the reviver builders or

explicitly mentioned in the associated bugs, I may conditionally

enable them on certain platforms.

But other than that, I won't include extra changes except for the

ones suggested by `git cl format`.





------ How to inspect the reviver builder results ------



You may choose a platform you are interested,

e.g. chromium/reviver/lacros-coordinator.

[link: https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/reviver/lacros-coordinator]

In the baseline builder / buildbucket.schedule step, e.g.

chromium/ci/linux-lacros-builder-rel - buildbucket.schedule,

there will be a luci run link.

[ex: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/reviver/runner/b8776966777608450081/overview]





------ Aggregated results of the tests involved ------



The following list shows how many times the changed tests were

*consistently* passing on the relevant builders.



content/test:content_unittests/SharedWorkerServiceImplTest.WebContentsDestroyed

127 fuchsia-fyi-arm64-dbg

150 fuchsia-fyi-x64-dbg

192 fuchsia-x64-rel

110 linux-lacros-tester-rel



data version: 2023-06-28 16:45:51



Bug: 1380293

entry.title: Prerender: Cancel on activation mismatch due to auxiliary browsing contexts
entry.content:
This CL cancels prerendering on activation mismatch due to the existence

of auxiliary browsing contexts with a new PrerenderFinalStatus. This

cancellation should be ok as a trigger page will be navigated away and

prerendered pages will eventually be destroyed.



This final status should be useful for web developers. Before this CL,

this activation mismatch was not shown anywhere, so they didn't know the

reason why prerendered pages were not used.

entry.title: FSA: Support multiple shared lock modes
entry.content:
Updates the FileSystemAccessLockManager to support multiple types of

shared modes. Each mode is exclusive to each other. You can open

multiple locks on a file of the same shared mode, but you cannot open

locks on the same file with different shared modes. There is a special

exclusive mode which only allows one lock to be open on the file.



There should be no behavioral changes.



Bug: 1382215

entry.title: [Test Automation] Observe states and wait for state changes
entry.content:
Lets you observe asynchronous world/browser state as part of a test, so that you can wait for a particular state or value rather than trying to emit events and catch them at precisely the right time.



Ppreviously you might need to do some weird parallel nonsense if

you didn't know when an event would come in, but it was a blocker to

proceeding with the test.



To wait for a state, create a StateObserver class, and start watching with `ObserveState(state_id, make_unique())`.



Then use `WaitForState(state_id, value)` or `WaitForStateMatch(state_id, value_matcher)` to wait for the state value you want.



Change-Id: Ie1de10f851e9f70f0172086d9089c16c094d9490

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4693923

Code-Coverage: Findit

Commit-Queue: Dana Fried

Reviewed-by: James Cook

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1172644}

entry.title: [iOS] Add initial Overflow Menu Destination Customization UI
entry.content:
This CL adds the initial UI for customization the order and show/hide

state of the destinations in the Overflow Menu UI. It uses the Apple-

provided drag/drop APIs to allow dragging destinations and dropping them

elsewhere in the destinations list (reordering) or a "Drop to hide"

target area (hiding).



There is more work here for the UI, including:

- Renaming the ActionCustomization* files to just Customization* as

they are no longer action specific.

- Showing full row UI for the hidden destinations (including button

to re-show).

- Add custom UTType so external drags are ignored.

- All model interactions

- Final strings



Demo: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1nUMWsN86O5W_EljIxV9FkAp7A0eWkIqM/view?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-10ipUk74FAj4VfSSVWEg5Q

entry.title: Only check kEnableMSAAOnNewIntelGPUs on eligible devices
entry.content:
Currently, only a small percentage of host devices are affected by the

experiment kEnableMSAAOnNewIntelGPUs. UMA does not provide the

necessary fields to filter results by Intel GPU generation ID, and

filtering by DeviceID is too tedious for practical analysis.



The purpose of this change is to modify the logic that checks the

experiment flag so that the experiment config can run with

starts_active = false in order to only enroll clients whose devices

are eligible for the experiment. This should allow the experiment

to produce clearer results with a higher degree of statistical

significance.



Bug: 1341830

Change-Id: I9cee90cbe1f6664d498dee93c147aa0b22706ff8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4680493

fuchsia-fyi-x64-asan build is broken due to detect_odr_violation in

rust.[1] and search for "odr-violation" in [2].



It's a known issue [3] and also impacts other platforms [4].



A previous attempt to disable the

sanitize-address-globals-dead-stripping

(in https://crrev.com/c/4690811) fixed media_unittests but broke

base_unittests. So I ended up deciding to follow the suggestion from

the sanitizer itself to use the environment variable.



Since there isn't a asan try, it takes 6+ hours to run, I have to

manually test the change locally. With this change, both media_unittests

and base_unittests are passing when is_asan = true in gn args.



[1]: https://chromium-swarm.appspot.com/task?id=6360bb22591abb10

[2]: https://cas-viewer.appspot.com/projects/chromium-swarm/instances/default_instance/blobs/be139e3b5b49518b8a83be3fcdc5c209dc2acc2c9f725c558dd3fc2aac93a558/404237?filename=emulator_log.serial

[3]: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/113404

[4]: https://crbug.com/1459233



Bug: 1459233, 1465997

entry.title: add a skip_base_tests flag to skip tests that appear in a virtual suite
entry.content:
This change will allow us to create the virtual suite for SingleThreaded

tests and only run the single threaded version of those tests, without

affecting other virtual suites.

This will allow to start running most WPT tests with threaded

compositing while keep running a small amount of the tests

single threaded.

entry.title: [Messages] Fix assertion error that onFinishHiding is not called
entry.content:
The assert indicates onFinishHiding is not called when all messages

have been hidden while the queue has already request for showing.



Per the crash stack, it is because the queue is updated (e.g. because

of tab switching) after the queue requests to show but before

browser control is fully visible.



This CL adds a call of onFinishHiding in this case.

entry.title: Add parser for header-based DirectFromSellerSignals
entry.content:
Multiple requests can return responses with Ad-Auction-Signals header

values, therefore AdAuctionPageData::GetAuctionSignalsForOrigin()

returns a set of string responses for a given input origin.



Each string response in the set should be a JSON array, with zero or

more dictionaries that have an `adSlot` field. The parser utility

iterates over the response set, finding and parsing the signals from the

first JSON dictionary that whose `adSlot` matches the specified

`adSlot`.



Invalid string responses (bad JSON, dictionary without `adSlot`, etc.)

are skipped.



For a page with N Ad-AuctionSignals responses, in the worst case, all N

Ad-Auction-Signals responses (as returned by

GetAuctionSignalsForOrigin() [0]) will be parsed for each auction /

component auction / top-level auction.



GetAuctionSignalsForOrigin() only returns the signals for a single

origin:



const std::set& GetAuctionSignalsForOrigin(

const url::Origin& origin) const;



It's expected that the size of the header responses and the number of

header responses and ad slots per seller origin should be low, such that

indexing or caching parsed results shouldn't be necessary. Furthermore,

in component auctions, each seller will be searching for a different set

of signals. UMA to verify these assumptions will land in a follow-up CL.



[0] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/interest_group/ad_auction_page_data.h;l=50;drc=a54d5c9143aca1ef087cf193e1b2b2d786889020



Bug: 1462720

Change-Id: I650dde1a6524205faaec20f66fbc2029af66ad7c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4670535

Commit-Queue: Caleb Raitto

Reviewed-by: Russ Hamilton

entry.title: vaapi: Remove usage of GL and libva-x11.
entry.content:
This CL removes the usage of GL stuff and the X11 libva API in the

VaapiWrapper in favor of always using libva-drm with no awareness of the

rendering API. This is possible now that we got rid of the legacy

VaapiVideoDecodeAccelerator code.



This has a few benefits:



1) Simplifies the VADisplayStateSingleton initialization since we can

use the same path for ChromeOS and Linux.



2) VaapiWrapper won't know and won't care about whether we use GL,

Vulkan, ANGLE or any combination thereof. That's abstracted already

by the SharedImage framework.



3) It will make it easier to get Linux to work with out-of-process video

decoding (OOP-VD).



Bug: 1326754

Test: HW decode acceleration works with CHROME_DEVEL_SANDBOX="${HOME}/chrome/chrome_sandbox" DISPLAY=:1.0 ~/chrome/chrome --user-data-dir=${HOME}/.chrome_dev_data --enable-features=VaapiVideoDecodeLinuxGL --disable-features=Vulkan --v=1 "https://crosvideo.appspot.com/?codec=h264&resolution=720&mute=true"

Change-Id: Ic3a959e35fc9dadfa654e7d07c1c4cfcf8d39a07

entry.title: [webauthn] Always filter passkeys by allow-list
entry.content:
When servicing a webauthn request, chrome requests discoverable

credential metadata matching the request from local authenticators.

These are filtered to match the request's allow list. However, GPM

passkeys are obtained directly from sync, so they are not being

filtered, which causes chrome to display passkeys that are not eligible

for the request.



ChromeAuthenticatorRequestDelegate's credential_filter_ already filters

all credentials after they are discovered, but only for conditional

requests. This CL expands that behaviour to cover modal requests as

well, which fixes the bug.



Bug: 1459273

Change-Id: I254a242b7c30ee8387c25c03a1bd8d0ca227d6d5

entry.title: view-transitions: Cache StyleSheetContents for UA CSS.
entry.content:
ViewTransitionStyleTracker is the source of truth for the dynamic style

sheet generated during a transition. Because it's currently cached as

a string, the state is duplicated in StyleEngine when its parsed into

a StyleSheetContents. This requires the need to invalidate state in

the StyleEngine when the UA CSS changes.



Switch to caching a StyleSheetContents object instead so the dynamic

style sheet doesn't need to be duplicated across multiple places. This

helps with an upcoming change for devtools which also needs a parsed

version of this stylesheet.



R=xiaocheng@chromium.org, vmpstr@chromium.org

entry.title: [ios] Refactor of FeedManagementNavigationDelegate usage
entry.content:
This change moves implementation of FeedManagementNavigationDelegate to

the NTP mediator and adds unit tests for the methods. Previously this

protocol was implemented by the NTP Coordinator where it proxied the

calls to nearly identical methods in the mediator.



This helps test coverage by removing the coordinator methods that simply

proxied the calls to the mediator (these methods did not have coverage),

and adds coverage for the mediator methods - two birds, one stone. It

also reduces redundancy by removing the coordinator methods.

entry.title: Roll proc-macro2 to 1.0.66
entry.content:
proc-macro2 was using an unstable feature in the stdlib that is going

away in the next rust roll, so this must be rolled forward to enable

future rust rolls. The same has had to be done in rustc and bindgen.



Steps taken:



rm -rf third_party/rust/proc_macro2/v1

cargo run --release --manifest-path tools/crates/gnrt/Cargo.toml --target-dir out/gnrt download proc-macro2 1.0.66 --security-critical=yes

cargo run --release --manifest-path tools/crates/gnrt/Cargo.toml --target-dir out/gnrt -- gen



I added `Shipped: yes` back to the CHROMIUM.readme which gnrt does not

add itself yet.



Bug: 1459183

Change-Id: I50ae51353749aa51c7947d41d1fff29cc9f05d3b

entry.title: Allow CCT/TWAs to bypass gesture requirement when returning to client
entry.content:
Custom Tabs and TWAs are often used for things like sign-on, where the

CCT/TWA is opened, then redirects back to the client. We fairly

recently added a 15 second timeout on navigation chains so that users

wouldn't be surprised by inactive tabs redirecting to apps. However,

this lead to flakiness in some CCT/TWA users as in some enterprise

scenarios login redirect chains can frequently take more than 15

seconds to complete.



Given the user is redirecting back to the app that opened the CCT/TWA

the abuse vector is very limited (requires the user to use a malicious

app), the user gesture/15 second timeout isn't very strong protection

to begin with, and the user probably expects to be returned to the app

that opened the tab, I think we can lift the restriction for this case.



Bug: 1464549

entry.title: Scalable Notifiers: fix ScalableIph for initial sessions
entry.content:
In early initialization stages, the device owner id is not yet cached

and so the `IsOwnerUser()` check will fail. In the case that there is

no set device owner, the current user will be registered as the owner

later so we will proceed to initialize ScalableIph.



This change fixes the issue where ScalableIph was failing in first

sessions (i.e. after OOBE).



Bug: b/289426010
